author: dlr
msg: * subversion/bindings/java/javahl/src/org/tigris/subversion/javahl/Status.java
(lastChangedDate, lockCreationDate): Documented that these dates are
represented in _microseconds_.
(microsecondsToDate): New class method which converts microseconds
since the epoch to a Date object.
(getLastChangedDate, getLockCreationDate): Refactored to leverage
the new microsecondsToDate() class method.

author: sussman
msg: ra_dav/mod_dav_svn bugfix:  'svn info URL' should show correct lock owner.
The problem is that -- just like lock->creationdate -- there's no
concept of lock->owner in the DAV universe.  When neon performs a
PROPFIND to learn lock details, mod_dav_svn inserts a custom
'creationdate' header into the response that ra_dav picks out.  This
patch adds the same behavior for marshalling the 'lock owner' field.
This patch fixes lock_tests.py #18 over ra_dav.
* subversion/include/svn_dav.h
(SVN_DAV_LOCK_OWNER_HEADER): new custom response header.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/lock.c
(dav_svn_get_locks, dav_svn_find_lock, dav_svn_append_locks):
send new header along with the custom creationdate header.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/ra_dav.h
(struct lock_request_baton):  add 'lock_owner' field to context.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/session.c
(handle_lock_owner_header):  new callback to parse new response header.
(pre_send_hook):  register callback for neon's LOCK and PROPFIND requests.
(shim_svn_ra_dav__lock, lock_receiver):  don't assume ras->auth_user
owns the lock, grab field from the context structure instead.
(svn_ra_dav__get_lock):  remove redundant check for creationdate;
lock_receiver callback was already doing this.

author: fitz
msg: Add a new test for Ben's 'svn info URL' bug (where the lock owner is
either missing or incorrect).  This test currently fails over DAV, but
ben will be committing a fix for it today.

(test_list): Add examine_lock_via_url to the list.
